story.text: PARIS Jan 2 French utility Suez LYOE.PA dismissed efforts by investor Francois Pinault to keep his options open on whether to launch a bid and urged regulators to put greater pressure on him to be clear. Asked by the AMF financial regulator to clarify his position following newspaper reports about a possible bid for Suez, Pinault's Artemis firm said earlier on Tuesday that it had taken no decision at the moment and was keeping all options open. Suez retorted with a statement calling Pinault's declaration "vague and imprecise" and said his group had given no indication of its real intentions. "As a result, Suez is once again asking the French securities regulator Autorite des Marches Financiers to enforce the new regulations and get the Pinault Group to unequivocally clarify its intebntions regarding a Suez bid or else relinquish them for a 6-month period." An AMF spokeswoman said it had nothing to add to an earlier indication that it was studying Pinault's statement.
story.title: suez not satisfied with pinault statement
